info.title: Memida API
info.description:
# Introduction
The Memida API is built on HTTP.  Our API is RESTful. It has predictable
resource URLs.  It returns HTTP response codes to indicate errors.  It also
accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body. You can use your favorite
HTTP/REST library for your programming language.

To ensure you receive JSON data, please include the `Accept: application/json` header in your HTTP request.

## Authentication
Generate your API key under More options â†’ API. You can also delete keys later (useful for rotating credentials).
To authenticate with the Memida API, include your secret key in the request headers.

:::info
During the test period, please contact us to request API access.
:::

Memida offers one form of authentication:  private key.
- private key: authenticates by the HTTP header: Auth (read more on this below).

Never share your secret keys. Keep them guarded and secure.
The client-side authentication scheme uses one HTTP header named Auth.


```json
{
    Auth: 'live XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX'
}
```

## API Error Responses

In our REST API, we follow standard HTTP status codes to indicate the result of each request. When an error occurs,
the API will return a JSON object with a dynamic error message to help you diagnose and resolve the issue.

### Dynamic Validator Response

```json
{
    error: {
        type: {
            is_type: 'type is not valid'
        }
    }
}
```

### HTTP Dynamic Response

```json
{
    message: 'Not Found',
    url: '/api/v1/files/info/50ece4de-1468-4a07-83f1-f66d5c1d397e4',
    code: 404
}
```

get.description:
Get list of apparatus basedata types. Returns both default
        types (system-wide) and custom types (organization-specific).

parameters.name: default
parameters.description:
Filter by default apparatus basedata types.
If `true` only default types will be returned

post.description:
Create new apparatus basedata type.
        :::tip
        We recommend to use a unique name for each apparatus basedata type.
        :::

get.description: Get a single apparatus basedata type by UUID

put.description: Edit apparatus basedata type. Default apparatus basedata types (system-wide) can also be edited.

delete.description:
Delete apparatus basedata type.
        :::info
        Deleted apparatus basedata types still exist in the system
        for record-keeping purposes but are marked as deleted and cannot be used in new records.
        They still show up in existing records where they were used before deletion.
        :::

get.description: Get list of apparatus basedatas (master data)

parameters.name: default
parameters.description:
Filter by default apparatus basedatas.
If `true` only default apparatus basedatas will be returned

post.description:
Create new apparatus basedata (master data), used when creating new apparatus.
        :::tip
        We recommend to use a unique combination of `model` (name/number),
        `manufacturer`, and `type` for each apparatus basedata.
        :::

delete.description:
Delete apparatus basedata.
        :::info
        Deleted basedatas still exist in the system for record-keeping purposes but are marked as
        deleted and cannot be used in new records.
        It still show up in existing records where they were used before deletion.
        :::

get.description: Get single apparatus basedata by UUID
Get all comments for a specific apparatus
Get single view of apparatus by `identno`
Get single view of apparatus by apparatus_id
Get list of all added custom_fields, sorted by `field_id` and `type`
Get details of a custom field

parameters.description: An identifier for a custom field.

parameters.description: An identifier for a custom field.

parameters.description: An identifier for a custom field.

parameters.description: An identifier for a custom field.

schema.description: `field_id` is unique in combination with the `type`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: An identifier for a custom field.

schema.description: `field_id` is unique in combination with the `type`

get.description: Get single File - returns the file as binary data with appropriate content-type header

delete.description:
The DELETE File Endpoint is a critical API resource that allows
        users to irreversibly delete a specified file. When you make a DELETE request to
        this endpoint, the file will be permanently removed and cannot be recovered.

get.description: Get list of inspection types. Custom inspection types (organization-specific).

Get list of manufacturers. Returns both default manufacturers (system-wide)
        and custom manufacturers (organization-specific).

parameters.name: default
parameters.description:
Filter by default manufacturers.
If `true` only default manufacturers will be returned

post.description:
Create new manufacturer.
        :::tip
        We recommend to use a unique name for each manufacturer.
        :::

get.description: Get a single manufacturer by UUID

put.description: Edit manufacturer. Default manufacturers (system-wide) can also be edited.

delete.description:
Delete manufacturer.
        :::info
        Deleted manufacturers still exist in the system for record-keeping purposes but
        are marked as deleted and cannot be used in new records.
        They still show up in existing records where they were used before deletion.
        :::

choices.description:
only in the `select` type
each select need a unique name

default_select.description:
only in the `select` type
choice: name of the select field

required.description:
When saving an old record, if a custom field is set to `required`, 
        it is ignored and not validated. The `required` setting only applies to new records,
        allowing old records to be saved without requiring the custom field.

default_select.description: only in the `select` type, choices id

modified.description: Last modified datetime of custom field

files.description:
Array of files to upload
Files can be deleted and downloaded via the `Files` API endpoint.

tags.name: Custom Fields
tags.description:
Custom Fields allow for the creation of dynamic fields that can be displayed across various views such as
`Apparatuses`, `Inspections`, `Testplans`. Each custom field is defined with attributes including an identifier,
type, title, and form configuration. The fields can be customized to suit specific requirements, for example,
by setting the form type (e.g., textarea, select, input), enabling or disabling the field,
 and specifying additional options like whether the field is required or its maximum length.
 This flexibility enables tailored data entry forms for different operational needs.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: The 'Files' endpoint allows for the management of files associated with Apparatuses, Testplans, and Inspections.
